info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 26 at 8:04PM EDT until July 26 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT FOR MERCER COUNTY... At 804 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenville, or 13 miles north of Sharpsville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Sharpsville, Greenville, Stoneboro, Sandy Lake, Clark, Jamestown, Fredonia, Jackson Center, New Lebanon, Sheakleyville, and Maurice K Goddard State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
